Sentencas: Nanopowders of La0.75Sr0.25Cr0.5Mn0.5O3-delta (LSCM) perovskite-type oxide, potential electrode material for symmetrical solid oxide fuel cell (S-SOFC), have been successfully prepared by the solution combustion method employing glycine as complexing agent and fuel.
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of pure-phase La0.75Sr0.25Cr0.5Mn0.5O3-δ nanocrystallites for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: Several glycine-to-nitrates molar ratios were investigated.
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of pure-phase La0.75Sr0.25Cr0.5Mn0.5O3-δ nanocrystallites for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: A detailed morphological and structural characterization was performed, employing X-ray diffraction, N-2 physisorption, and electron microscopy (scanning and transmission).
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of pure-phase La0.75Sr0.25Cr0.5Mn0.5O3-δ nanocrystallites for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: The as-synthesized LSCM nanopowders consist of interconnected nanoparticles forming a sponge-like structure with typical meso-and macropores.
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of pure-phase La0.75Sr0.25Cr0.5Mn0.5O3-δ nanocrystallites for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: For glycine-to-nitrates molar ratios above stoichiometric molar ratio, a high proportion of well-crystallized LSCM phase was obtained.
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of pure-phase La0.75Sr0.25Cr0.5Mn0.5O3-δ nanocrystallites for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: An increase of glycine content in the initial synthesis gel, decreases the average nanoparticles size from similar to 20 to similar to 6 nm, narrows the distribution crystallite size, and increases the specific surface area of the LSCM nanopowders from similar to 14 to similar to 30 m(2)/g.
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of pure-phase La0.75Sr0.25Cr0.5Mn0.5O3-δ nanocrystallites for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: The evolution of crystalline phases of the as-synthesized LSCM nanopowders after calcination at various temperatures was studied: pure-phase La0.75Sr0.25Cr0.5Mn0.5O3-delta perovskites with particle-size distribution between 100 and 300 nm, have been obtained after calcination at 1,000 degrees C for 6 h. The crystalline structural analyses showed that the LSCM nanocrystallites have trigonal/rhombohedral symmetry in the R-3c space group.
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of pure-phase La0.75Sr0.25Cr0.5Mn0.5O3-δ nanocrystallites for solid oxide fuel cell applications

Sentencas: These final LSCM nanopowders present microstructures with low densification and open porosity but probably with sufficient integrity to enable them to be used as efficient electrodes in S-SOFC.
Titulo: Synthesis and characterization of pure-phase La0.75Sr0.25Cr0.5Mn0.5O3-δ nanocrystallites for solid oxide fuel cell applications
